meanings.definition: A person who wears a blousy garment.
meanings.sent1: The blousier always chooses comfortable blousy tops.
meanings.sent2: She is known as the blousier in our group because of her love for loose clothing.
meanings.sent3: The blousier at the party had a wardrobe malfunction when her blousy shirt got caught on a chair.
meanings.sent4: In a sea of fitted outfits, she stood out like a blousier cloud in the sky.
meanings.sent5: The blousier's fashion sense was as airy and light as a feather.

meanings.sent1: Her blousier dress billowed in the wind as she walked.
meanings.sent2: The blousier sleeves of the shirt added a relaxed vibe to her outfit.
meanings.sent3: The blousier balloon decorations made the party feel whimsical and fun.
meanings.sent4: The blousier clouds in the sky resembled fluffy cotton candy.
meanings.sent5: The blousier curtains gave the room a cozy and casual feel.

meanings.definition: To make something appear more blousy.
meanings.sent1: She decided to blousier her shirt by tucking it loosely into her pants.
meanings.sent2: The fashion designer blousiered the sleeves of the dress for a more relaxed look.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally blousiered his hair by using too much volumizing mousse.
meanings.sent4: The wind blousiered the leaves on the trees, creating a rustling sound.
meanings.sent5: The chef blousiered the omelette by adding extra beaten eggs for a fluffier texture.
